intro: Calycothrix tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf calycothrix, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clustered flowers. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually small and white or pale pink. It produces small, dry fruits that contain minute seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in its native range.
